metadata.name: PsExec Service Child Process Execution as LOCAL SYSTEM
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND lower(process.parent_process.name) = lower('c:\\windows\\psexesvc.exe') AND (contains(lower(actor.user.name), lower('authori')) OR contains(lower(actor.user.name), lower('autori'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious launch of the PSEXESVC service on this system and a sub process run as LOCAL_SYSTEM (-s), which means that someone remotely started a command on this system running it with highest privileges and not only the privileges of the login user account (e.g. the administrator account)

metadata.objective: False positive: Users that debug Microsoft Intune issues using the commands mentioned in the official documentation; see https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/mem/intune/apps/intune-management-extension Reference: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/psexec
